name: Cranberry Orange Wheat Scones
author: 24Twists
summary: These scones are a delicious and nutritious snack that is wonderful when warm with some butter.  They are also good for freezing, on the go eating and they'll be sure to please guests who stop by.  Yummy!
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
In a large bowl, stir together the whole wheat flour, wheat germ, brown sugar, baking powder, salt and nutmeg
Mix in shortening until everything looks crumbly
Stir in the cranberries and orange zest
In a separate bowl, stir together the egg, milk and orange juice
Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet mixture
Turn out onto a floured surface and knead briefly to get the dough to hold together
Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness and cut into circles with a biscuit cutter
Place scones 2 inches apart on the baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until the tops and bottoms are golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes
